RelatedSentence: On 13 March 2014 , the Communities and Local Government Committee of the House of Commons published its report on local government procurement .

A0: Local Government Committee of the House of Commons
RelatedSentence: This is the result of an inquiry that the committee launched in July 2013 to look at how effective recent procurement reforms had been in improving local government procurement approaches and the potential for further development .

A0: Local Government Committee of the House of Commons
RelatedSentence: This is the result of an inquiry that the committee launched in July 2013 to look at how effective recent procurement reforms had been in improving local government procurement approaches and the potential for further development .
The inquiry looked at whether local government would benefit from using a centralised procurement system such as central government 's Crown Commercial Service .
The view was that local authorities needed to retain local control over procurement , in order to best meet local needs .
